question: Is the protein pelota a ribosomal rescue factor?
ideal_answer: Yes, in eukaryotes, Pelota (Dom34 in yeast) and Hbs1 are responsible for solving general problems of ribosomal stall in translation.

snippets.text: a novel binding partner of the ribosome recycling protein Pelota
n eukaryotes, Pelota (Dom34 in yeast) and Hbs1 are responsible for solving general problems of ribosomal stall in translation.
In eukaryotes, the protein complex of Pelota (yeast Dom34) and Hbs1 translational GTPase recognizes the stalled ribosome containing the defective mRNA.
